Package sportstournament.ui

Class CommandLine

java.lang.Object
sportstournament.ui.CommandLine
public class CommandLine extends Object
command line interface for the game environment can take input from console and perform actions
Author:
Isaac Steele and Reuben Schoonbee

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    CommandLine()
    default constructor which creates an instance of the command line interface with a scanner

    Prints the options the user can select if they go to the Stadium.

  • Method Details

    • SetUp

      public void SetUp(GameEnvironment game)
      prompts the users name and athlete selection and returns the information to the game environment
      Parameters:
      game - The instance of GameEnvironment used to keep track of the game

    • getNumWeeks

      public int getNumWeeks()
      Returns the number of weeks the game shall be played for
      Returns:
      the number of weeks the game shall be played for

    • getName

      public String getName()
      prompts player to enter a name for the team and checks it is valid
      Returns:
      The team name

    • draftAthletes

      public ArrayList<Athlete> draftAthletes(GameEnvironment game)
      prompts player to select athletes and returns their selected team
      Parameters:
      game - The instance of GameEnvironment used to keep track of the game
      Returns:
      the drafted athletes

    • printDraftOptions

      public void printDraftOptions(ArrayList<Athlete> draft)
      takes the list of available players to draft and displays the number to select them and their stats
      Parameters:
      draft - the list of available athletes to draft

    • start

      public void start()
      starts the main game run loop where the user selects the action they want to perform terminates when no more weeks are remaining

    • printMainOptions

      public void printMainOptions()
      prints out the options available to the user from the main screen

    • handleMainOption

      public void handleMainOption(int selection)
      handles user selection from the main screen
      Parameters:
      selection - the chosen option

    • getIntegerInput

      public int getIntegerInput(int numOptions)
      a helper method that takes an integer which represents the number of options the user can select it then prompts the user for input and checks if the input is valid then returns the integer
      Parameters:
      numOptions - the number of options
      Returns:
      an integer representing the selected option

    • singleIntegerInput

      public void singleIntegerInput(int optionNum)
      helper method that keeps prompting user for a specific input until it is received used for situations where there is only one options available
      Parameters:
      optionNum - the number of options

    • printClubOptions

      public void printClubOptions()
      prints the initial options the user can select from the club screen

    • printSubOffOptions

      public void printSubOffOptions(Club club)
      prints the options for the player to be subbed off
      Parameters:
      club - The user's Club

    • printSubOnOptions

      public void printSubOnOptions(Club club)
      prints the options for the player to be subbed on
      Parameters:
      club - The user's Club

    • printInventoryOptions

      public void printInventoryOptions(Club club)
      prints the items in the inventory to be used plus an option to return to club
      Parameters:
      club - The user's Club

    • printWholeTeam

      public void printWholeTeam(Club club)
      displays all the athletes in the club including the active team and the reserves used so user can select an athlete to use an item on
      Parameters:
      club - The user's Club

    • StadiumOptions

      public void StadiumOptions()
      Prints the options the user can select if they go to the Stadium.
